en.purpose: To calculate the body mass index.
en.use: BMI is calculated using the formula: BMI = weight / [height]², where weight is in kilograms and height is in meters.
en.misuse: To interpret the result of the BMI calculated here, use the BMI assessment guideline.

other_details.en: Body mass index (BMI) is a simple index of weight-for-height that is commonly used to classify overweight and obesity in adults. It is defined as a person's weight in kilograms divided by the square of his height in meters (kg/m2).

gt0001.description:
Body mass index (BMI) is a simple index of weight-for-height that is commonly used to classify overweight and obesity in adults. 

Frame of reference as defined by the World Health Organization (WHO):
Below 18,5 - underweight,
18,5-24,9 - normal weight,
25,0-29,9 - overweight,
30,0-34,9 - obesity class I,
35,0 - 39,9 - obesity class II,
Above 40,0 - obesity class III
